citation.article-title: Labrys monahos, a new budding prosthecate bacterium with radial symmetry.

p.s: Cells are gram-negative, nonmotile, nonspore-bearins, flat, possess triangular radial symmetry.
Do not possess complex membrane structures.
G+C content of the DNA is 67.9±1 moles.
Aerobic, oligocarbophilic, utlize carbohydrates as sole carbon and energy source.
Type strain 42 was isolated from silt of Lake Mustijärv (Estonian SSR), and has been deposited with the Institute of Microbiology, Academy of Sciences of the USSR.
